title: Esa and isa2 prep
content: I'm in sem1 chem cycle and I need to know hoe to prepare for them specially math ,epd and python like what did u guys refer to other than notes or slides?

comments.body:
I can tell you about ESAs, though keep in mind that I wrote them two years ago, so things may have changed.

Python: It’s easy. I only managed to study one unit because I was very sick before the exam, yet I somehow still scored an A. The questions are straightforward, and most of the codes were from the slides. You’ll be fine as long as you can actually write basic codes and understand the logic.


EPD: The numericals are often directly copied from the slides, and many of the same questions are repeated year after year. Going through the PYQs will definitely help.


Math: I wasn’t great at it, so I’d rather not say much. Just make sure to practice as much as possible, from classwork, assignments, qb, tb, anything because the paper tends to be lengthy.

For maths, be consistent, that's it. 

Try to solve questions on ur own rather than copying what's on board during class. 

After a unit is over, try to complete the assignments within 2-3 days (doesn't take more than 30 mins)
